description: I love to keep track of BTC throught the day, and now I can view it at a glance without it taking up any screen real estate. I changed the update from 10s to 5 minutes.
summary: Works great! I love to watch the fluctuations throughout the day

description: I have tried different pairs and update intervals, but it remains to be extremely inaccurate.
My ticker is accurate. Not 100%, thats okay. It's just a tiny ass lil ticker in my sys tray.
why would it want to access my /home directory

It tries to do exactly what I need, a price ticker in the system tray, but after 4 or 5 refreshes, it just locks on a price and never changes it again.
I tried installing the gnome extensions, reinstalling this app, creating a Bittrex API key to use, but nothing worked. It seems like it gets the new price (because the icon changes to green or red) but fails to update the number. Such a shame...
summary: It would be great if it worked

description:
Updates the price of Bitcoin every so often. I don't look up at the corner enough to focus on it, so I'm not sure what the intervals are, but it's cute and really handy for not staring at your actual portfolio all day.
All I can ask for is more functionality, and more coins .
Fails to update according to its intervals. Not sure if it updates according to different candles or what, but maybe some things need fixing. Then again this is linux.

I love the app, does exactly what I want, however, it is lacking a few functionalities that I've expected:
- Ability to search for pairs
- Add multiple pairs to my bar
summary: It's amazing but I expected more

description:
As already mentionned by previous comments, it's a great idea, and integration in the tray is perfect, with possibility to have several instances of the software launched to display ETH alongside BTC for instance...but the behind-the-scene soft needs LOTS OF REWORK:
- refresh hangs after the first update
- why API keys required?! That's nonsense since ticker pricing is not individual related
- Who still uses Bittrex in 2021?! Just remove this unnecessary (and sketchy) API key requirement and just fetch the data from Coingecko or CoinMarketCap (I suggest a toggle option allowing the user to choose between these 2 sources, adding a level of redundancy in case either oracle fails)
In the meantime, I'll be using Ticker, another soft needing to be launched manually into a terminal, so less modern/practical/ergonomic, but which works perfectly fine with stocks, cryptos, etc...
summary: Good idea...but unfortunately bugged: wouldn't recommend

description:
I am using btcusdt and usdeth tickers

Two things wrong in Babas review
- API key can be left blank, so its not needed.
- Ticker works after several updates
summary: Some mistakes in Babas review. App works great till now

description: segfaults out of the box on Ubuntu 22.04
Eso solo, podrìan poner una alarma tambièn en X precio
summary: De un dìa al otro dejò de abrir

description:
It works. Provides minimal info for minimal CPU, which is what I need.
Currency pair selection could be improved though.
